title: GB riders win five European Para-dressage bronzes
summary: Mari Durward-Akhurst wins her second and Great Britain's fifth bronze medal at the European Para-Dressage Championships.

title: 'The title fight that refuses to get nasty, even when McLaren create their own controversy'
summary: McLaren generated a problem for themselves during the Italian Grand Prix but have so far avoided any acrimony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: France thrash South Africa to finish top of Pool D
summary: France beat South Africa 57-10 in their Pool D decider to set up a quarter-final agaisnt Ireland at the Women's Rugby Union World Cup.

title: Bethell's first ton sets up record England win over SA
summary: Jacob Bethell scores his first professional century before Jofra Archer runs through South Africa as England earn a thumping consolation victory in Southampton.

summary: Jacob Bethell scores his first professional century before Jofra Archer runs through South Africa as England earn a thumping consolation victory in Southampton.

title: France comfortably set up Ireland quarter-final
summary: France face Ireland next Sunday in the Women's Rugby World Cup quarter-finals, sealing top spot in Pool D by hammering South Africa in Northampton.

summary: Jockeys Jim Crowley and Trevor Whelan are taken to hospital after suffering falls in a race at York.

title: Bethell and Archer star as England beat South Africa by record margin

title: Hampshire dominate Durham to make One-Day Cup semis
summary: Hampshire qualify for the semi-finals of the Women's One-Day Cup with a comfortable nine-wicket win over Durham.

title: McIlroy wins Irish Open in dramatic play-off
summary: Rory McIlroy holds his nerve to win the Irish Open in a dramatic play-off and claim his first victory since completing the career Grand Slam at the Masters in April.

title: Pro-Palestinian protester causes crash in Vuelta
summary: A pro-Palestinian protester causes a minor crash with 56km left on stage 15 of the Vuelta a Espana - which Mads Pedersen wins with fellow Dane Jonas Vingegaard still the overall leader.

title: Vignola hat-trick gives Everton win at Anfield
summary: Everton's new signing Ornella Vignola scores a statement hat-trick to help her team beat Liverpool 4-1 at Anfield.

summary: Hull KR move to the brink of winning the League Leaders' Shield after defeating city rivals Hull FC in a ferocious local derby.

summary: Watch Ruby Tui's reactions to watching New Zealand beat Ireland 40-0 at the Women's Rugby Union World Cup.

summary: England international Caitlin Beevers returns to action for Leeds after more than a year out injured in their Women's Super League win over Huddersfield.

summary: Braxton Sorensen-McGee scores a hat-trick of tries as world champions New Zealand beat Ireland 40-0 and secure top spot in Pool C of the Women's Rugby World Cup.

summary: Teenage wing Braxton Sorensen-McGee scores a hat-trick of tries as reigning world champions New Zealand showed their class to beat Ireland 40-0 and secure top spot in Pool C.

summary: Salford second-row Emmanuel Waine is released from hospital three days after being knocked unconscious during their Super League loss to Catalans.

title: Sabalenka retains US Open to win first Grand Slam of 2025
summary: Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka beats American Amanda Anisimova 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to retain the US Open and win her first Grand Slam of 2025, having already lost the Australian and French Open finals earlier this year.

summary: Alex Marquez beats brother Marc to victory at the MotoGP of Catalonia and end his seven race winning streak.
